column3:
I'm not sure we want to start making file changes in anticipation of events 6 months ahead. This also means that any gitian builds of master between this merging and the 2016-07 are from the future? :watch: 

Other than being the 'real' date, what value does changing these add. I'm assuming the dates are already new enough that the binary file views isn't an issue?
Maybe we can get gitian to pull it from the git commit date?\n

@fanquake I will add this to `release-process.md`, so @laanwj can do it before every release.

@luke-jr  I'd prefer this option as well...
Agree with @luke-jr: can we not load the date from the tag/commit date? Time could set be set to 00:00.\n

> Time could set be set to 00:00

No need to fiddle with the time. Imo it makes sense to have the exact commit (author) date corresponding to the commit which is shown in the debug window.
@jonasschnelli Would be nice to see if this works on your build box. Make sure to update gitian-builder, first.\n

> @fanquake I will add this to release-process.md, so @laanwj can do it before every release.

If you do this, please automate it (you can find the commit timestamp using some git command?), it's not worth adding another manual step to me.
Needs rebase. Closing for now and making it a new pull.\n
